events.foot_note: <sup>*</sup>Mouse over the Event Code Description to know more details.
events.alarms_error:
Log cannot be displayed.
An internal error has prevented the display of the historical alarms.
events.warnings_error:
Log cannot be displayed.
An internal error has prevented the display of the historical warnings.

2.long_desc: The grid voltage exceeds the inverter allowable range. Protection time and protection threshold vary as per different country requirements.

3.long_desc: Grid transient voltage exceeds the permissible range.

4.long_desc: The grid voltage is below inverter allowable lower limit. Protection time and protection threshold vary as per different country requirements.

5.long_desc: The grid voltage is too low.

7.long_desc: The AC output current exceeds the inverter protection limit.

8.long_desc: The grid frequency exceeds the inverter allowable upper limit.

9.long_desc: The grid frequency exceeds the inverter allowable lower limit.

11.long_desc: The DC component of AC current exceeds the inverter limit.

14.long_desc: The average grid voltage keeps exceeding the allowable range for over 10 minutes.

23.long_desc: PV configuration mode has changed during normal operation.

25.long_desc: Transient unbalance of voltage neutral point.

38.long_desc: A fault is detected in the relay.

47.long_desc: PV input settings do not match the actual connecion.

75.long_desc: Solar irradiation is not sufficient for inverter operation.

548.long_desc: String 1 power module output current abnormal

549.long_desc: String 2 power module output current abnormal

550.long_desc: String 3 power module output current abnormal

551.long_desc: String 4 power module output current abnormal

552.long_desc: String 5 power module output current abnormal

553.long_desc: String 6 power module output current abnormal

554.long_desc: String 7 power module output current abnormal

555.long_desc: String 8 power module output current abnormal

556.long_desc: String 9 power module output current abnormal

557.long_desc: String 10 power module output current abnormal

558.long_desc: String 11 power module output current abnormal

559.long_desc: String 12 power module output current abnormal

560.long_desc: String 13 power module output current abnormal

561.long_desc: String 14 power module output current abnormal

710.long_desc: The System configuration done by the user/ installer is incorrect. Check and select proper configuration. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

711.long_desc: The internal configuration shared between processors is incorrect. Disconnect both the AC and DC and restart the inverter. If the event persists contact Schneider Electric customer service

205.long_desc: Initialization of Control Processor fails. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

203.long_desc: Initialization of Control Processor fails.  If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

705.long_desc: PV input wiring reversed. Have a qualified installer check PV input wiring, correct the wiring connections and restart the unit

206.long_desc: Built in Self Test of Control Processor fails. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

204.long_desc: Built in Self Test of Control Processor fails. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

712.long_desc: The internal configuration is incorrect on the Control Processors. Restart the unit. If the event persists contact Schneider Electric customer service

713.long_desc: The internal configuration is incorrect on the Control Processors. Restart the unit. If the event persists contact Schneider Electric customer service

32.long_desc: The AC Module temperature is either very high or low. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

33.long_desc: The DC Module temperature is either very high or low. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

709.long_desc: The unit has detected an Arc Fault condition. An Arc Fault can be reset only manually. For more details, refer the ?Arc Fault Detection? section in the manual. If the event occurs frequently, contact Schneider Electric customer service

704.long_desc: Arc fault detection module failure detected. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

714.long_desc: The RPO power module has failed. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

10.long_desc: Line Tie relay is either welded or opened. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

47.long_desc: The Grid voltage sensor fails to measure the voltage accurately. Reset the unit by turning off the DC disconnect. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

702.long_desc: The Earth Leakage current is repeatedly detected to be greater than limited value. Check whether the insulation between the PV to ground is higher than the specified value. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

708.long_desc: The Earth Leakage current is greater than the limited value. It is checked for repeated occurrence. If the repetition occurs more than four times, then this fault occurs. Check whether the insulation between the PV to ground is higher than the specified value. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

31.long_desc: The Grid Current Sensor is not measuring the grid current accurately. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

131.long_desc: The losses in the unit are higher than normal and hence the efficiency is Low. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2616.long_desc: The PV insulation measured between any PV input to earth is lesser than the specified limit. Have a qualified installer to check for PV resistance

2647.long_desc: RCMU error detected. Excessive steady state residual current or sudden change in residual current. The inverter resumes normal operation after sometime. Wait for the inverter to resume power production

2646.long_desc: RCMU error detected. Excessive steady state residual current or sudden change in residual current. The inverter resumes normal operation after sometime. Wait for the inverter to resume power production

701.long_desc: The DC content in the AC output current is higher than rated value. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

706.long_desc: The instantaneous value of DC content in the AC output current is higher than rated value. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2061.long_desc: The inverter ambient or AC module temperature is beyond the safe operating limits of the inverter. Switch off the power to the unit, for it to cool. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2062.long_desc: The temperature on DC Power modules is beyond the limits. The ambient is beyond the operating limits. Switch off the power to the unit for it to cool. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2624.long_desc: The current measured on both the PV channels is higher than the rated values. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2406.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is below the set limits. The fall in the grid voltage is rapid. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2407.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is above the set limits. The rise in the grid voltage is rapid. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2401.long_desc: The Grid Frequency is below the set limits. The fall in the grid frequency is rapid. Check the frequency, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2402.long_desc: The Grid Frequency is above the set limits. The rise in the grid frequency is rapid. Check the frequency, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2418.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is below the set limits. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2419.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is above the set limits. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2416.long_desc: The Grid Frequency is below the set limits. Check the frequency, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2417.long_desc: The Grid Frequency is above the set limits. Check the frequency, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2415.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is above the limits over a set period of time. Restart the inverter. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2410.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is below the set limits instantaneously. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2408.long_desc: The Grid Voltage is above the set limits instantaneously. Check the voltage, if it is within the operating limits and the problem persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2460.long_desc: The current measured in any one phase is beyond the specified limits. Restart the inverter. If the event persists, then contact Schneider Electric customer service

2648.long_desc: The losses in the unit are higher than normal. So efficiency is low. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

2060.long_desc: The temperature on the AC power modules is lower than the limits. The unit does not start. Wait till the temperature rises to a value greater than the normal temperature

2411.long_desc: The Grid Current is above the set limits instantaneously. Restart the inverter. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2605.long_desc: The voltage measured at PV1 input terminal is greater than the specified limit. (>950 V). Check for PV configuration and voltage

2606.long_desc: The voltage measured at the PV2 input terminal is greater than the specified limit (>950 V). Check for PV configuration and voltage

2631.long_desc: PV voltages on both the channels are lesser than the specified value (<200 V)

2018.long_desc: This error occurs, when the internal communication between processors in the control board fails after time out. Reset the unit by turning OFF both the DC disconnect and AC breaker (external). If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2101.long_desc: This error occurs, when the internal communication between processors in the control board fails after time out. Reset the unit by turning OFF both the DC disconnect and AC breaker (external). If the event persists then contact Schneider Electric customer service

4680.short_desc: Invalid Date and Time settings detected
4680.long_desc: Invalid Date and Time settings detected

4661.long_desc: The SPD module connected on the PV1 input channel reached EOL and needs replacement. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

4662.long_desc: The SPD module connected on the PV2 input channel reached EOL and needs replacement. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

4663.long_desc: The SPD module connected on the AC output channel reached EOL and needs replacement. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

4003.long_desc: Fault or FAN EOL detected and needs FAN replacement. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

4004.long_desc: Fan Control circuit hardware failure has been detected. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

4068.long_desc: The DC Module1 over temperature is detected and the power output from PV1 channel is stopped. The PV1 channel resumes power production once the temperature reduces to a value less than the threshold value

4069.long_desc: The DC Module2 Over temperature detected and power output from PV2 channel is stopped. The PV2 channel resumes the power production once the temperature reduces to a value less than the threshold value

2633.long_desc: PV1 Over current detected, hence the power output from PV1 is stopped. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

2634.long_desc: PV2 Over current detected, hence the power output from PV2 is stopped. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

4061.long_desc: The ambient temperature has crossed the nominal operating range and the unit starts to derate

4660.long_desc: The temperature on the AC module has crossed the normal operating limit and the unit starts to derate

4065.long_desc: The DC module1 temperature crossed the nominal operating limits and the unit starts to derate

4066.long_desc: The DC module2 temperature crossed the nominal operating limits. The unit may start to derate and recover once the temperature reduces to a value less than the threshold value

4656.long_desc: The input PV voltage is lower than the nominal operating limits at the PV1 input terminal

4657.long_desc: The input PV voltage is lower than the nominal operating limits at the PV2 input terminal

4700.long_desc: The input PV power is low. The unit does not go online and recovers when sufficient input power is available

8000.long_desc: Internal error reported by the processor. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service with the inverter LCD display details

9000.long_desc: Internal error reported by the processor. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service with the inverter LCD display details

703.long_desc: Comm MCU detected Arc fault condition. Contact Schneider Electric customer service

2102.long_desc: Communication error in the Control processor detected by Comm processor. Restart the inverter. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service

7000.long_desc: Internal error reported by Communication Processor. If the event persists, contact Schneider Electric customer service with the inverter LCD display details

1.short_desc: Phase A Voltage out of range
1.long_desc: Phase A Voltage out of range

2.short_desc: Phase B Voltage out of range
2.long_desc: Phase B Voltage out of range

3.short_desc: Phase C Voltage out of range
3.long_desc: Phase C Voltage out of range

4.short_desc: Phase A Current out of range
4.long_desc: Phase A Current out of range

5.short_desc: Phase B Current out of range
5.long_desc: Phase B Current out of range

6.short_desc: Phase C Current out of range
6.long_desc: Phase C Current out of range

7.short_desc: Frequency out of range of 45 to 65Hz
7.long_desc: Frequency out of range of 45 to 65Hz
